alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 26 at 10:58PM CST until February 26 at 11:15PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... McIntosh County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southern Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Central Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma... Southeastern Okfuskee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 1115 PM CST. * At 1058 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Henryetta, moving northeast at 105 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Eufaula... Henryetta... Checotah... Weleetka... Dewar... Schulter... Oktaha... Grayson... Council Hill... Rentiesville... Hoffman... Stidham... Lake Eufaula State Park... Pharoah... Vivian... Wainwright... Hitchita... Bryant... Pierce... Onapa... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 229 and 274. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
